pages.text: Rottweilers only have one gene that has been witnessed to affect how they look, and this is the B Locus. This gene will determine whether they have tan-colored points or rust points.
Within the breed, a rare variant has been observed as well. While not understood well, this variation will show on genetics tests.
pages.title: Overview Cont.

pages.text: The B Locus has two potential alleles, the dominant 'B' and the recessive 'b'. The 'B' allele creates redder, rust points, while the 'b' allele creates less saturated, tan points. Dogs with one copy of 'b' will carry the tan trait and may pass it on to pups, providing the potential for tan pups depending on the other parent. Dogs with two copies of 'b' will always create either tan carriers or tan puppies.
pages.title: B Locus

pages.text: Some dogs have a trait that darkens rust fur to mahogany. This trait will only show on dogs with rust-colored points. Genetically, this trait isn't completely understood, however markers for the trait have still been found and show on genetic tests and the trait can be passed from parents to pups.
pages.title: Mahogany Variant
